## Matplotlib Graph

```{pyodide}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Generate some data
x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y = np.sin(x)

# Create the plot
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 6))
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.title("Simple Matplotlib Graph")
plt.xlabel("X-axis")
plt.ylabel("Y-axis")
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()
```

## Sympy

```{pyodide}
import sympy as sym
sym.init_printing()

t, sigma, omega = sym.symbols('t sigma omega', real=True)
s = sigma + 1j*omega
x = sym.exp(s*t)
x
y = x.subs({omega: 10, sigma: -.1})

sym.plot(sym.re(y), (t, 0, 2*sym.pi), ylabel=r'Re{$e^{st}$}')
sym.plot(sym.im(y), (t, 0, 2*sym.pi), ylabel=r'Im{$e^{st}$}');
```

## Visualizing CT vs. DT Signals

```{pyodide}
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.figure(figsize=(8, 4))
t = np.linspace(-2, 2, 500)
x_t = np.cos(2 * np.pi * t)
plt.plot(t, x_t, label='$x(t) = \cos(2\pi t)$', color='blue')
plt.title('Continuous-Time Signal $x(t)$')
plt.xlabel('Time (t)')
plt.ylabel('Amplitude')
plt.grid(True)
plt.axhline(0, color='black',linewidth=0.5)
plt.axvline(0, color='black',linewidth=0.5)
plt.show()
```
